abstract: New documentary The Magnitsky Act -- Behind the Scenes suggests Sergei L Magnitsky, Russian lawyer who died mysteriously in Moscow prison, was not whistle blower and victim of police brutality; business associate of Magnitsky moves to block screenings of film, whose respected director Andrei Nekrasov became skeptical of previously accepted narrative.

headline.print_headline: Film on Russian’s Death  Provokes Uproar in U.S.
headline.main: Film About Russian Lawyer’s Death Creates an Uproar

keywords.value: The Magnitsky Act -- Behind the Scenes (Movie)
keywords.name: creative_works

snippet: Critics are trying to block a Washington screening of a documentary that portrays Sergei L. Magnitsky, who died in a Moscow prison cell, as an accomplice rather than a victim.
lead_paragraph: Critics are trying to block a Washington screening of a documentary that portrays Sergei L. Magnitsky, who died in a Moscow prison cell, as an accomplice rather than a victim.
